dt: {bc}the permanent as contrasted with the {d_link|accidental|accidental:1} element of being
{bc}the individual, real, or ultimate nature of a thing especially as opposed to its {d_link|existence|existence}

dt.t: a painting that captures the {wi}essence{/wi} of the land

dt: {bc}the properties or {d_link|attributes|attribute:1} by means of which something can be placed in its proper class or identified as being what it is
{bc}the most significant element, quality, or aspect of a thing or person
{bc}one that possesses or exhibits a quality in abundance as if in concentrated form
{bc}a constituent or {d_link|derivative|derivative:1} possessing the special qualities (as of a plant or drug) in concentrated form
{bc}a preparation of such an essence or a synthetic substitute

quotes.t: The perennial debate about nature and nurture—which is the more potent shaper of the human {qword}essence{/qword}?—is perennially rekindled.
In {qword}essence{/qword}, the positivists were the first sociologists, rejecting both superstition and metaphysics and studying behavior as a natural phenomenon that could be perfected.
I had come to Orange Cove on a statewide tour, looking for the {qword}essence{/qword} of Latino life in a changing California and a good bowl of the Mexican stew …

dt: {bc}a translucent substance that occurs in the silvery scales of various fish (such as herring) and is used in making artificial pearls, lacquers, and plastics
